com.mp3player.vdp

Class Distributed

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mp3player.vdp.Distributed
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public abstract class Distributed
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    All objects that are shared among clients extend Distributed.

    Each distributed object has a unique ID which must be provided in the constructor. If multiple objects with the same ID are detected resolveConflict(Conflict) is called to determine which one will be kept. The other instance is then discarded.

    When a distributed object is changed locally, it must call fireChangedLocally() which triggers the synchronization process. After each change (by the local peer or a connected peer) all changeListeners receive a DataChangeEvent.

    The synchronization is implemented using serialization to transfer the data and reflection to copy the data to the local object. This procedure ensures that any references to the shared object stay valid after synchronization.

    Author:
    Philipp Holl
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Distributed

        public Distributed(java.lang.String id,
                   boolean permanent,
                   boolean ownerBound)
        Creates a new Distributed object which is not yet bound to any network. Binding to a network happens automatically when VDP.putData(Distributed) is called.
        Parameters:
        id - unique data ID with which the object can be found

    • Method Detail

      • resolveConflict

        public abstract Distributed resolveConflict(Conflict conflict)
        Called on the local copy when two objects with the same ID are detected. A conflict can arise when two peers connect which both have a shared object with the same ID. This method then resolves the conflict by providing the object to keep.
        Parameters:
        conflict - detailed information about the conflict
        Returns:
        the object to keep with this ID. This can be this, other or a newly created object. All other objects are discarded.

      • addDataChangeListener

        public void addDataChangeListener(java.util.function.Consumer<DataChangeEvent> l)
        Adds a listener that will be informed whenever part of this object's data is modified. The modification could have happened locally or by a different peer.
        Parameters:
        l - listener

      • removeDataChangeListener

        public void removeDataChangeListener(java.util.function.Consumer<DataChangeEvent> l)
        Removes a change listener.
        Parameters:
        l - listener to remove

      • getID

        public final java.lang.String getID()
        Returns the unique ID of this distributed object.
        Returns:
        the unique ID

      • isPermanent

        public boolean isPermanent()
        This object will only be serialized and written to file if the permanent flag is set to true.
        Returns:
        whether the permanent flag is set

      • isOwnerBound

        public boolean isOwnerBound()
        Specifies whether the data is valid only as long as it's owner is connected to the network. Also, if true, the data will only be written to file on the owner's machine.
        Returns:
        whether the owner-bound flag is set
